meanings.sent1: The workers hirsled the heavy crate across the warehouse floor.
meanings.sent2: She hirsled the suitcase up the stairs with determination.
meanings.sent3: The little dog hirsled the oversized bone, looking quite determined.
meanings.sent4: He hirsled his way through the dense crowd to reach the front of the line.
meanings.sent5: The old car hirsled and groaned as it struggled up the steep hill.

meanings.definition: To move or push with great effort.
meanings.sent1: They hirsled the boulder out of the way to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: The team hirsled the heavy equipment to the construction site.
meanings.sent3: She hirsled the stubborn door open after multiple attempts.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete hirsled through the last stretch of the race.
meanings.sent5: The children hirsled the large box across the room, giggling with effort.

meanings.sent1: The shepherd hirsled the sheep into the pen before sunset.
meanings.sent2: The cowboys hirsled the cattle across the open range.
meanings.sent3: The farmer hirsled the chickens back into their coop at dusk.
meanings.sent4: The border collie hirsled the scattered sheep back together with ease.
meanings.sent5: The rancher hirsled the horses into the barn for the night.
